Lunarpine Howls loudly as the rifle hits him in the stomoch. He curls 
up into a fetal position until he hit the ground. Now both bots had a 
critical wound that needed tending as soon as possible. If he took 
another solid shot like that he might not make it back for repairs. 
(He was to busy fighting Slayer to notice how badly the Ark was 
damaged.) But the same went for Slayer, if he didn't get back to 
wherever his base was he'd gointo stasis lock too. The fight was 
meaningless right now, if it continued both would cease to function. 
Lunarpine transformed to full wolf mode to save energy and speed up 
repairs. He took a defensive stance in front of Slayer and started a 
stareing contest. "This is turning senseless. If we both stay out 
here we're both dead if we go our seperate ways we might live to pick 
this up another day." He stepped back a few steps ready to move at a 
moments notice. "We're to evenly matched, I see that now, how about a 
rain check till we meet again?"

--- In nbwrpg@egroups.com, Yanshosh@a... wrote:
> ::Slayer::
> 
> Skayer growls as Lunarpine's claws take out his shoulder cannons, 
> sending both bots flying back from the impact. Bringing up his 
rifle 
> right up to Lunarpine's stomach, he pull sthe trigger.
> 
> He needed to end this battle soon, he was lacking fluids at an 
> alarming rate.
> 
> 
> 
> 
> 
> --- In nbwrpg@egroups.com, cyberwolf4@p... wrote:
> > IN his half wolf state Lunarpines repair systems continue to 
work. 
> > This fight was pushing his systems to the limits, as soon as one 
> > wound was healed another opened. Slayer seemed to know this. 
Pride 
> > seemed to be the only reason this fight continued. Lunarpine 
> refused 
> > to lose. He wasn't losing fluid nearly as fast as Slayer so he 
knew 
> > that he could outlast the bot even if it caust Lunarpine his own 
> > life. He wanted to save Shadow Wing but not if it cost the rest 
of 
> > the maximals thier lives by giving the traitor the chance to 
live. 
> If 
> > he left Slayer's weapons alone Slayer would continue fighting and 
> > Lunarpine would have the opportunity to finish him. He had a 
better 
> > idea though. he leapt forward again slashing both claws at 
Slayers 
> > shoulder cannons and biting for his neck. If he got a hold on him 
> at 
> > close range this battle would be as good as over with Lunarpine 
the 
> > victor.
